class_description:
NSArchiver, a concrete subclass of NSCoder, provides a way to encode objects into an architecture-independent format that can be stored in a file. When you archive a graph of objects, the class information and instance variables for each object are written to the archive. The companion class NSUnarchiver decodes the data in an archive and creates a graph of objects equivalent to the original set.
NSArchiver stores the archive data in a mutable data object (NSMutableData). After encoding the objects, you can have the NSArchiver object write this mutable data object immediately to a file, or you can retrieve the mutable data object for some other use.
In macOS 10.2 and later, NSArchiver and NSUnarchiver have been replaced by NSKeyedArchiver and NSKeyedUnarchiver respectively—see Archives and Serializations Programming Guide.

return_description: An archiver object, initialized to encode stream and version information into data.

Methods.method_description: Returns an archiver, initialized to encode stream and version information into a given mutable data object.

params.param_description: The root object of the object graph to archive.

return_description: A data object containing the encoded form of the object graph whose root object is rootObject.

Methods.method_description: Returns a data object containing the encoded form of the object graph whose root object is given.
Methods.method_declar: class func archivedData(withRootObject rootObject: Any) -> Data

params.param_description: The root object of the object graph to archive.
The location of the the file into which to write the archive.

return_description: true if the archive was written successfully, otherwise false.

Methods.method_description: Creates a temporary instance of NSArchiver and archives an object graph by encoding it into a data object and writing the resulting data object to a specified file.
Methods.method_declar: class func archiveRootObject(_ rootObject: Any, toFile path: String) -> Bool

params.param_description: The root object of the object graph to archive.

Methods.method_description: Archives a given object along with all the objects to which it is connected.

params.param_description: The real name of an encoded class.

return_description: The name of the class used to archive instances of the class trueName.

Methods.method_description: Returns the name of the class used to archive instances of the class with a given true name.

params.param_description: The real name of a class in the object graph being archived.
The name of the class to use in the archive in place of trueName.

Methods.method_description: Encodes a substitute name for the class with a given true name.
Methods.method_declar: func encodeClassName(_ trueName: String, intoClassName inArchiveName: String)

params.param_description: An object in the object graph being archived.
The object with which to replace object in the archive.

Methods.method_description: Causes the receiver to treat subsequent requests to encode a given object as though they were requests to encode another given object.
Methods.method_declar: func replace(_ object: Any, with newObject: Any)

Vars.var_description: The name of an exception raised by NSArchiver if there are problems initializing or encoding.
